title.narrative: Envelope 1 : "Igniting Resiliency among the Conflict-Affected Syrian Population in north Syria through the establish renewable energy modalities (solar system) for the water stations and supporting WASH services (2)"

description.narrative: The project is designed to respond to the WASH needs of 10778 people (Men: 1875, Women: 2099, Girls: 3505, Boys: 3299),( 3829 IDPs, 6949 hosted people, of them 372 Persons with Disabilities), who are living in Eastern Marj Akhdar, and Dorriyeh communities and ( Al Bonyan/ Darkosh, Ali Bin Abi Taleb/Darkosh) camps, Idleb governorate to meet their protracted needs by ensuring the proper access to sustainable WASH services, SECD is planning to operate the targeted water stations by the solar power to minimize the operational cost and ensure the sustainability of the operation At the moment all the targeted stations, are either stopped ( Dorriyeh) or its fuel support will be finished on 31-12-2021 (Eastern Marj Akhdar) according to the need assessment and the coordination with GOAL ( which supports Eastern Marj Akhdar water station. Moreover, the project will supply the water stations of Eastern Marj Akhdar, and Dorriyeh with the solar power system to pump the water to both communities and to the nearest campsites in Dorriyeh ( Al Bonyan/ Darkosh, Ali Bin Abi Taleb/Darkosh) . SECD is planning to support the targeted communities and camps with the following activities: -One solar system for the water station of Eastern Marj Akhdar of the capacity of 100 Hp to operate the water station that can pump 75m3/hour, and ensure that each capita will receive 35 L/p/d of clean water. -One solar system for the water station of Dorriyeh: of a capacity of 30Hp for operation the water station that can pump 30 m3/hour, and ensure that each capita will receive 35 -40 L/p/d, the water system of Dorriyeh will be extended to be connected to the Al Bonyan/ Darkosh, and Ali Bin Abi Taleb/Darkosh camps, about 970 IDPs stay in those camps will receive 35-40 L of clean water through the water network. Supporting sanitation works which include: -Provision and installation of 650 garbage bins 0.1m3 size for targeted communities. - Provision of 2 solid waste trucks with a trail -Support SWM unit with salaries and fuel for 5 months, with Conducting solid waste campaigns to encourage people to participate in this humanitarian effort. -Rehabilitation of some sewer system lines in Eastern Marj Akhdar and Dorriyeh which includes but is not limited to Rehabilitation and extending of Sewer system network ( (HDPE 30cm diameter ):1500m, And 22 manholes, and iron channels in the streets for collecting the rainwater to avoid any possible flood. -Daily cleaning of 12 latrine blocks in Al Bonyan amp Ali Bin Abi Taleb camps -Conducting 5 hygiene promotion campaigns, SECD will target the entire communities with at least COVID -19 awareness. The hygiene promotion campaigns will focus on the protection measures of COVID 19, SECD will adhere to the recommendation of the WASH cluster in the implementation of the hygiene promotion sessions, during these campaigns SECD will distribute PSEA brochures for beneficiaries to increase the knowledge and access to PSEA reporting hotline.SECD conducted similar projects funded by SCHF (TUR-20/3559/RA1/WASH/NGO/14973 and TUR-21/3559/SA1/WASH/NGO/18343) during 2020-2021 with good performance SECD will use the lessons learned in the implementation. (P.L TPM1,TPM2)
